data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetize
abilities.text: If you have any Metal Energy attached to your Active Pokémon, the Retreat Cost for that Pokémon is 0.

attacks.name: Metal Blast
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to Magnezone.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

abilities.name: Magnetic Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Lightning or Metal Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crush Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Magnezone.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Super Connectivity
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Lightning or Metal Energy card and attach it to your Active Pokémon. Then, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: You may switch Magnezone with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

data.name: Magnezone-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Magnezone

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Magnet Slash
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Magnezone.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

data.name: Magnezone

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Magnezone.

attacks.name: Metallic Bolt
attacks.text: You may discard a Lightning Energy and a Metal Energy attached to Magnezone. If you do, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Dual Brains
abilities.text: During your turn, you may play 2 Supporter cards.

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.

data.name: Magnezone

attacks.name: Double Assist
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Lightning and Metal type.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bolt
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It uses radar to monitor its territory. Intruders are quickly disposed of with a hyper beam.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

data.name: Magnezone-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Magnetic Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Lost Burn
attacks.text: Put as many Energy cards attached to your Pokémon as you like in the Lost Zone. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards put in the Lost Zone in this way.

data.name: Magnezone LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Magnezone. Magnezone LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Electric Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Lightning or Metal Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Cyber Shock
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy and a Metal Energy attached to Magnezone. The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Giga Magnet
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it's being controlled by some mysterious being.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Giga Magnet
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it's being controlled by some mysterious being.

data.name: Magnezone V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magnetic Tension
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splitting Beam
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Magnezone VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magnetic Grip
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Item cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electro Star
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Magnezone ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pulse Launcher
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They're formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

data.name: Magnezone ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Magnezone

attacks.name: Magnetic Repulsion
attacks.text: You may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

attacks.name: Mighty Magnetism
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon.

attacks.name: Upper Spark
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Magneton during this turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: Flashing Bolt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Flashing Bolt.
